newsitem.title: BOTSWANA: Botswana postpones pula hedge fund launch.
newsitem.headline: Botswana postpones pula hedge fund launch.

text.p: The launch of Regent Pacific Group's $50 million Undervalued Assets Africa Fund, originally fixed for December 17, has been postponed until next month, the Botswana stock exchange (BSE) said.
"The launch will be reviewed mid-January, when it is anticipated the fund will go forward," a statement said. "The problem was getting decision-makers together ahead of the Christmas holiday."
The same problems had been experienced in Dublin and Nairobi where the fund was also to be listed, it added.
According to the prospectus, subscriptions totalling $20 million would have to be received for the fund to go ahead.
The fund would be Botswana's first pula hedge stock and was expected to be welcomed by domestic investors.
BSE stocks depreciated 25 percent over the past year against most hard currencies as the pula has followed the slide of the South African rand.
The fund, registered in the Cayman Islands, will be primary-listed in Dublin and dual listed on the Botswana and Nairobi exchanges.

The fund, 35.4 percent weighted towards investments in mining, would seek to obtain capital growth by investing in opportunities perceived to be undervalued, fund manager Joe Demby told a presentation in Gaborone on October 28.
In terms of the target asset portfolio, 2.5 percent of the fund would be invested in Botswana and 10.2 percent in Kenya.
